intro: Aspalathus retroflexa subsp. empetrifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient plant in its native habitat.
